page.title: 13 DANCE'S ANIMAL FEEDSTUFFS
page.content: Dances is on the junction of Gateforth Lane in Hambleton.Their main job is to mill food for the animals.They don't do a lot of barley but they mix together bones,meat,dried milk and starch.They grind the food together and make it into powder.The raw materials are brought from all over the country and when the food has been milled they are sent all over the north of England including British Oil and Cake Mills in Selby where they are made into animal pellets.The present firm began in 1965 and employs 5 men.Mr.Dances father was manager before him and he's been there for 20 years.The building itself is a listed building and is protected by the government and was built in 1816.They work from 8.00-5.00.When the ingrediants have been milled they are stored at Campeys Storage Depot.
